page.title: 01Customs
page.content: Within the boundary of the Royal Forest of Dean some people claim the right of Common,to graze sheep on the open forest known locally as Commoners rights.they are called in local dialect "Sheep Badgers".It is thought that this claim dates back to Norman times,when local landowners on the forest edges were allowed to graze animals on the forest in compensation for damage done by the Kings deer. Grazing is not allowed in the enclosed forest. There are 10 "sheep badgers" in this area running about 800 sheep. Many road accidents are caused by wandering sheep. Local people may claim the right of Pannage ie: to turn loose on the open forest, pigs to eat the acorns during the Autumn months. Pollyanna Catlin.
